results.title: Sex differences in the orofacial antinociceptive effect of metformin and the role of transient receptor potential channels.
results.text_hl: @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@Metformin@@@ promotes orofacial antinociception in both sexes in @<m>DISEASE_Acute_Pain</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D059787 @@@acute pain@@@ and is more effective in @DISEASE_Chronic_Pain @DISEASE_MESH:D059350 @@@chronic pain@@@ in females than in males, through the modulation of @GENE_TRPV1 @GENE_7442 @@@TRPV1@@@ and @GENE_TRPA1 @GENE_8989 @@@TRPA1@@@ channels.

citations.NLM: Santos SAAR, Damasceno MBMV, Sessle BJ, Vieira-Neto AE, de Oliveira Leite G, Magalhães FEA, Tavares KCS, Benevides SC, Campos AR. Sex differences in the orofacial antinociceptive effect of metformin and the role of transient receptor potential channels. Naunyn Schmiedebergs Arch Pharmacol. 2024 Oct 2;():. PMID: 39356320
citations.BibTeX: @article{39356320, title={Sex differences in the orofacial antinociceptive effect of metformin and the role of transient receptor potential channels.}, author={Santos SAAR and Damasceno MBMV and Sessle BJ and Vieira-Neto AE and de Oliveira Leite G and Magalhães FEA and Tavares KCS and Benevides SC and Campos AR}, journal={Naunyn Schmiedebergs Arch Pharmacol}}
